question: The "Ras Banas Peninsula" is located in which country?
explanation: Ras Banas Peninsula is a peninsula located in Eastern Egypt facing the Red Sea. The inlet of water sheltered to the south of the peninsula is called Foul Bay, at the head of which situates the ancient Port of Berenice. It is believed that Mukawwa Island located to the southern tip of the peninsula, may have been connected to the peninsula at some point in the past however little or no research has been conducted to support this claim.
